title: 4 Destinations to Explore with a Mauritius Package (Pooja Shree)
text: By Pooja Shree Aug 8, 2015 Mauritius is a fascinating island nation set in the midst of the expansive Indian Ocean. Famed for its transcendental beauty, lent by the surrounding cobalt-blue waters, the country is a dream destination for thousands of globetrotters across the world. Tourists can book Mauritius package tours, to explore this heavenly landmass. Decades of colonisation under the Dutch, French and British, and a history of migration from neighbouring Asian and African continents has rendered a unique historical and cultural heritage to the isle. It is bestowed with an extremely diverse flora and fauna, accompanied by beautiful landscapes. Black River Gorges National Park, Sir Seewoosagur Botanic Garden, Tamarind Falls and Vallee des Couleurs are a few places to be explored in this island paradise. Black River Gorges National Park A spectacular area of the island is covered with thick forests and hills, and is home to many endemic species of flowers and birds. Demarcated as the Black River Gorges National Park, it is among the best known and biggest national parks of the nation, covering around 2 per cent land of the country. A primary habitat for rarest species of plants, threatened indigenous birds and a large number of giant fruit bats, the area was declared a national park in 1994. Tourists can go for hiking along the forest trails to observe animals playing and resting in their natural habitat. Tourists travelling with Mauritius vacation packages can spend a day exploring this gift of nature. Sir Seewoosagur Botanic Garden The Mauritius National Botanical Garden, officially called Sir Seewoosagur Botanic Garden is home to an incredible number of tropical and indigenous plants. One of the most-visited attractions of the island, it contains a wide collection of tropical woody plants and 85 different species of palms. Among the variety of plants it stores, the most famous are baobabs, palmier bouteille and the giant water lilies. It is also home to dozens of medicinal plants and a large spice garden. Botany enthusiasts can book Mauritius holiday packages to visit this interesting depot of flora. Tamarind Falls Hiking to Tamarind Falls is one of the favourite activities of travellers in Mauritius. A journey to this hard-to-reach waterfalls, situated in the Central Plateau, showers hikers with astounding views of mountains, rivers and forests, revealing the true essence of the island nation. Among the most serene locations of Mauritius, it also offers adventurers the opportunity to indulge in the beauty of its deep ponds and multiple jump points. Vallee des Couleurs Nature enthusiasts can experience the splendour of nature at the best in the Vallee des Couleurs. A visit to this national park includes a tour of the green valleys, hills, waterfalls and volcanic ashes. The fascinating 23 Coloured Earth, which dates back to millions of years, following the eruption of Bassin Blanc volcano, is a major attraction of this nature park. Tourists can also engage in fun activities like quad biking that takes bikers on thrilling rides through muddy banks, water splashes and dirt trails. It also has the longest ziplines of Mauritius, which visitors can try for a scenic view of the reserve with adrenaline rushing through the veins. The natural habitat of wild deer, peacocks, tortoises, ducks, hares and monkeys, it is known for its rich vegetation and rare animal and bird species. About the Author These are the 4 incredible places to visit in Mauritius for all tourists to witness and experience the imposing Mother Earth.
